name: Bahrain
description: Bahrain, an island nation in the Persian Gulf, is a fascinating blend of ancient history, modern development, and stunning natural landscapes. Known as the 'Pearl of the Gulf,' it boasts a rich cultural heritage, a thriving economy, and a diverse ecosystem. From its dramatic limestone cliffs and pristine beaches to its bustling capital city, Manama, Bahrain offers a unique and rewarding travel experience.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.description: Bahrain's population is a mix of Bahrainis, expatriates, and other nationalities.
quickFacts.detail: The majority of the population resides in urban areas, particularly in Manama and other industrial cities.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: Manama is the vibrant capital and largest city of Bahrain.
quickFacts.detail: It's a bustling hub of commerce, culture, and entertainment, featuring historic souks and modern skyscrapers.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.description: The official currency of Bahrain is the Bahraini Dinar.
quickFacts.detail: It's pegged to the US dollar at a rate of 0.375 BHD = 1 USD.

quickFacts.label: Language
quickFacts.description: Arabic is the official language of Bahrain.
quickFacts.detail: English is widely spoken and used in business and tourism.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.description: Bahrain is a relatively small island nation.
quickFacts.detail: It's approximately the size of Singapore.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.detail: Oil and gas are significant contributors, but tourism, finance, and manufacturing are also important sectors.

climateData.title: Bahrain's Climate
climateData.description: Bahrain experiences a hot desert climate with significant temperature variations throughout the year. Summers are extremely hot and humid, while winters are mild and pleasant. Rainfall is scarce, primarily occurring during the winter months.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Summer (June - August)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Bahrain's summer months are characterized by intense heat and humidity. Temperatures frequently exceed 40°C (104°F).

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Autumn (September - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Autumn brings a slight decrease in temperatures and humidity, offering more comfortable conditions for outdoor activities.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Winter (December - February)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Winter is the most pleasant time to visit Bahrain, with mild temperatures and lower humidity. Rainfall is more frequent during this period.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Spring (March - May)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Spring brings a return of warmer temperatures and sunshine, with blooming desert flowers adding to the beauty of the landscape.

naturalWonders.name: Barayan Island
naturalWonders.description: Barayan Island is a stunning artificial island located off the coast of Bahrain. It's a testament to human ingenuity and offers a unique blend of natural beauty and modern amenities.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The island features a lagoon, beaches, and lush landscaping. It's a popular destination for water sports and relaxation, offering a tranquil escape from the bustling city.
viewingTips: Book water sports activities in advance

naturalWonders.name: Al-Janadurah Wildlife Sanctuary
naturalWonders.description: Al-Janadurah Wildlife Sanctuary is a vital coastal wetland ecosystem, providing a refuge for a diverse range of bird species and other wildlife.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The sanctuary is characterized by its tidal marshes, mangroves, and mudflats. It plays a crucial role in protecting Bahrain's coastline and supporting biodiversity.

naturalWonders.name: The Bahrain Desert
naturalWonders.description: The Bahrain Desert is a vast expanse of sand dunes and rocky terrain, offering a dramatic and otherworldly landscape.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The desert is home to unique flora and fauna adapted to the harsh conditions. It's a popular destination for desert adventures and stargazing.

ecosystemData.title: Bahrain's Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Bahrain's ecosystems are remarkably diverse, ranging from coastal wetlands and coral reefs to arid deserts and rocky hills. These ecosystems support a rich array of plant and animal life, many of which are endemic to the region.

biodiversityCategories.name: Marine Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Bahrain's coral reefs and coastal waters are home to a diverse range of marine life, including coral, fish, sea turtles, and dolphins.

statistics.details: Over 60 different coral species have been identified.
More than 300 species of fish inhabit the waters around Bahrain.

notableSpecies.name: Hawksbill Turtle
notableSpecies.significance: A key indicator of reef health.

notableSpecies.name: Dolphin
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Bahrain's coastal heritage.

biodiversityCategories.name: Terrestrial Biodiversity
biodiversityCategories.description: Bahrain's deserts and rocky hills support a unique array of plants and animals adapted to the arid conditions.

statistics.details: Over 250 plant species have been recorded.
More than 60 reptile species inhabit the desert.

notableSpecies.name: Arabian Urial
notableSpecies.significance: A symbol of Bahrain's wild heritage.

notableSpecies.name: Sand Cat
notableSpecies.significance: A rare and elusive desert predator.

activities.title: Activities in Bahrain
activities.description: Bahrain offers a wide range of activities for visitors of all interests, from water sports and desert adventures to cultural experiences and historical explorations.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water sports in Bahrain's warm, clear waters.

activities.name: Jet Skiing
activities.description: Experience the thrill of speeding across the Arabian Gulf.

activities.name: Windsurfing
activities.description: Harness the power of the wind and glide across the water.

activityCategories.name: Desert Adventures
activityCategories.description: Explore Bahrain's stunning desert landscapes on thrilling adventures.

activities.name: Dune Bashing
activities.description: Experience the adrenaline rush of driving over towering sand dunes.

activities.name: Camel Trekking
activities.description: Embark on a traditional camel trek through the desert.

clothing.winter: Layers of clothing, sweater, jacket, scarf, gloves
